declarations.comments: Create tree from given single value. |
declarations.title: leaf

declarations.comments: Create tree from given value and its children. |
declarations.title: node

declarations.comments: Get value of this tree node. |
declarations.title: value

declarations.comments: Get children of the this tree node. |
declarations.title: children

declarations.comments: Node that only has leaves |
declarations.title: lnodeOp

declarations.comments: Convert tree to a flat array structure:
declarations.title: flatten

declarations.comments: Call this function on both the value and chidlren of this tree node. |
declarations.title: break

declarations.comments: Set value of the tree node. |
declarations.title: set

declarations.comments: Update value of the tree node using its current value. |
declarations.title: update

declarations.comments: Leave only `Just` values in the tree. |
declarations.title: catMaybes
edges

declarations.comments: Path is an array of positions of nodes required to be visited to reach some node. |
declarations.title: Path

declarations.comments: Root path. |
declarations.title: root

declarations.comments: Go deeper one level at the point with given index. |
declarations.title: advance

declarations.comments: Go up one level. |
declarations.title: up

declarations.comments: Convert path to an array. |
declarations.title: toArray

declarations.comments: Create path from array. |
declarations.title: fromArray

declarations.comments: How deep is this path in the tree. |
declarations.title: depth

declarations.comments: Fill every value in this tree with its full path. |
declarations.title: fill

declarations.comments: Find a deeper tree node by its given path. |
declarations.title: find

declarations.comments: Call a function with the tree node at the given path. |
declarations.title: with

declarations.comments: Walk around the complete tree, calling a function at every node with its path, value and children. |
declarations.title: traverse

declarations.comments: Pair every value in the tree with how deep it is in this tree. |
declarations.title: fillDepths

declarations.comments: If first path contains full second path. They could be equal, but the second path couldn't be longer than the first one. Every path contains `root`. |
declarations.title: startsWith

declarations.comments: Value at given depth. |
declarations.title: posAt

declarations.comments: Value at the last position. |
declarations.title: lastPos

declarations.comments: If first path contains full second path, and the first path is exactly one level deeper than the second.
declarations.title: isNextFor

declarations.comments: Navigate deeper by given index but only if the index is in the bounds of how many children are accessibly by this path. |
declarations.title: safeAdvance

declarations.comments: If the tree contains something at given path. |
declarations.title: existsAt

declarations.comments: Safely go one level up to the root. |
declarations.title: safeUp

declarations.comments: Safely go one level deeper, when possible. |
declarations.title: safeDown

declarations.comments: Safely go to the next neigbouring child from the same parent. |
declarations.title: safeRight

declarations.comments: Safely go to the previous neigbouring child from the same parent. |
declarations.title: safeLeft

declarations.comments: Safely (by checking bounds from this tree) advance this path one step in the requested direction:
declarations.title: advanceDir
